alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 3:06AM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 6000 feet. Occasional snow showers continue today, with the heaviest snow expected late this evening into early Saturday morning. Winds gusting 25 to 35 mph late tonight with patchy blowing snow. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Prescott, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute and any New Year`s Eve travel plans. Additional snow forecast from 2 AM Today to 5 AM Saturday: Doney Park 1 to 3 inches Flagstaff 4 to 6 inches Grand Canyon 2 to 4 inches Jacob Lake 4 to 8 inches North Rim 4 to 8 inches Prescott 0 to 1 inches Valle 1 to 3 inches Williams 3 to 5 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains
